pages.text:
1  
      200 ISEE Words to Know for Lower Level      (If possible, please print me double-sided!)    Test Innovators, Inc.  Copyright © 2018

2  
      Thank you for purchasing the 200 ISEE Words to Know for Elementary Levels from Test Innovators.  This list is intended to prepare your child or student for their once-a-year opportunity to take the official ISEE.  This document includes 200 words with synonyms for definitions. Students will also benefit from making up and writing down a sentence using each new word.   Many students will already know some of the words in this list. Students can then make a plan to learn a certain number of new words each month or week. For example, if a student has 6 months before the exam, he or she can endeavor to learn 50 words a month - about 10 or 12 words a week. If a student has only 3 months before the test, he or she will have more like 25 words a week to study.*   *However, students should not feel pressure to learn every word on this list.  As tutors, we recommend that if a student has only a month or two to prepare before an exam that they focus their energies on learning strategies, completing timed sections, and building confidence.  Students can also make flashcards using the words found here, or use the Test Innovators flashcards found on Quizlet: https://quizlet.com/testinnovators/folders.   Any of these 200 words may appear on the official Lower Level ISEE.  This download is not for multiple students’ use. Distributing this download or printed versions of this document to people other than the one student for whom it was purchased is prohibited.  Tutoring companies and schools with interest in securing a license to re-use this document can contact: support@iseepracticetest.com           *The Independent School Entrance Examination and ISEE are trademarks owned by Educational Records Bureau. *Test names and other trademarks are the property of the respective trademark holders. None of the trademark holders are affiliated with or sponsored by iseepracticetest.com.

17  
      200 ISEE Words to Know: Synonym Practice for Lower Level     (If possible, please print me double-sided!)        Test Innovators, Inc.  Copyright © 2018

18  
      Thank you for purchasing the 200 ISEE Words to Know: Synonym Practice for Lower Level from Test Innovators.  This document includes the 200 words from our 300_Words_to_Know vocabulary list as ISEE-like synonyms. Each question includes a word in capital letters followed by four answer choices. Students should pick the answer choice that is the closest in meaning to the capitalized word.  These synonyms are intended to help students to practice the capitalized vocabulary. Therefore, the four answer choices are intended to be of similar difficulty or easier than the capitalized word. On the real ISEE, sometimes the answer choices may be more difficult than the capitalized question word. Our purpose here is to provide a means for students to gauge how many of our 300_Words_to_Know they have learned.   Any of the 200 words are likely to appear on the official ISEE.  This download is not for multiple students’ use. Distributing this download or printed versions of this document to people other than the one student for whom it was purchased is prohibited.  Tutoring companies and schools with interest in securing a license to re-use this document can contact: support@iseepracticetest.com              *The Independent School Entrance Examination and ISEE are trademarks owned by Educational Records Bureau. *Test names and other trademarks are the property of the respective trademark holders. None of the trademark holders are affiliated with or sponsored by iseepracticetest.com.

19  
Directions: Each word in capital letters is followed by four lettered answer choices. Choose the answer choice that is most nearly the same in meaning as the capitalized word. The best answer will be the closest synonym of the capitalized word. 1. ABOLISH:  (A) rely (B) flutter (C) absorb (D) eliminate  2. ABSURD:  (A) nervous (B) wealthy (C) ridiculous (D) bare  3. ACCUMULATE:  (A) wander (B) collect (C) observe (D) revive  4. ACCUSTOM:  (A) steer (B) familiarize (C) grasp (D) capture  5. ADAPT: (A) adjust (B) cling (C) decay (D) scatter  6. ADEQUATE: (A) famous (B) harmful (C) safe (D) acceptable   7. ADHERE: (A) approach or tackle (B) stick to or follow (C) predict or foresee (D) imitate or duplicate  8. ADHESIVE: (A) glue (B) rate (C) cable (D) marsh  9. ADMIRE: (A) prevent (B) remark (C) enable (D) respect  10. AFFECT: (A) accuse (B) influence (C) glide (D) consider  11. AGGRAVATE: (A) locate (B) worsen (C) convince (D) doze  12. ALTER: (A) respect (B) spoil (C) change (D) limit

metadata.title: IndirectObject(223, 0, 281473172160176)
metadata.creator: IndirectObject(225, 0, 281473172160176)
key_concepts: _ Escalate (verb): increase rapidly, climb up, soar
_ Effective (adj.): successful, powerful, producing a result
_ Resonate (verb): echo, vibrate, make a sound
_ Affect (verb): (different from effect) influence, impact, alter
_ Immerse (verb): soak in liquid, drench, submerge
_ Illogical (adj.): not making sense, false, incorrect
_ Nutritive (adj.): healthy, good for you, strengthening
__ Accustom (verb): make normal, adapt to, get used to
_ Alternate (verb): rotate, take turns, follow one another
_ Confirm (verb): agree on, establish as true, affirm
_ Dedicate (verb): devote time, commit, give to
_ Retain (verb): hold on to, contain, own
_ Enlist (verb): join, enroll in, sign up for
_ Scorn (verb): look down on, ridicule, make fun of
_ Alter (verb): (different from altar) change, modify, make different
_ Complement (verb): (different from compliment) accompany, enhance, add to
_ Bountiful (adj.): plentiful, abundant, a generous amount
_ Farce (noun): joke, mockery, waste of time
_ Sprawl (verb): lie down, spread out, extend
